sponsor.partnerMessage: Make downtown Bentonville your future workplace. Ledger offers custom spaces, flexible membership levels, and bookable meeting rooms blocks from the square. Join Ledger by January 1 to receive 50% off your first 3 months.

posts.title: Trotting To The Thanksgiving Table
posts.content:
For some of you, this Thursday wont only include a turkey, but also a trot.

  • Distance: Turkey-Trot "fun runs" are happening all over NWA this Thursday for Thanksgiving. With multiple distances to choose from these family friendly runs make for a fun tradition.
  • Support: You have the 11th Annual SHS Bulldog Football Turkey Trot in Springdale, a Turkey Trot-n-Trek at Lake Fayetteville, and the 14th Annual Turkey Trot for Heroes in Rogers.

For a list of state-wide races, click HERE.

posts.title: More Perfect
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
You won't want to miss out on this next piece that will be displayed at Crystal Bridges. 

  • Parchment: Though the specifics haven't been released, a rare first printing of the US Constitution will be in the halls of Crystal Bridges second half of 2022. 
  • Bid war: This first edition copy of the US Constitution was sold at a Sotheby’s auction last Thursday. The purchase price was $43.2m, which included outbidding 17,000 cryptocurrency investors.

Read more about the plans HERE.

posts.title: Competing at D1 Level
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas is growing with spaces for athletes and professional sports training.

  • Staying strong: Two D1 Training facilities are coming to Bentonville and Fayetteville, making them the 4th and 5th locations in Arkansas. Both locations are slated to open within the next 18 months.
  • Fitness: D1 Training is a national franchise with over 50 locations all offering scholastic, adult, and professional training.

Read more HERE.

posts.title: Grab Your Santa Hats And Tinsel
posts.content:
The holiday tradition of Christmas on the Creek in downtown Springdale is back and as grand as ever. 

  • See and do: Festivities will be on Nov. 27 throughout downtown with a holiday market, an ART WALK, a hot cocoa crawl, and live music. You won't want to miss the Christmas Parade or the lighting of the tallest live tree in NWA!
  • Get in on the fun: You can join Cycling Santas, a family friendly bike ride through the downtown streets with stops for treats, or join the Parade of Trees fundraiser where families, nonprofits, and businesses can sponsor and decorate one of the trees that will line downtown.

Fore more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Coming To You
posts.content:
Healthcare just got a little more convenient in NWA for some. There is a new healthcare provider relocating to Bentonville that exclusively makes house calls. 

  • To your home: Basis Health’s mission is to “change healthcare” by increasing access specifically to the elderly and chronically ill. Patients in the area are currently comprised of “assisted living, independent living, memory care and homebound patients.”
  • Constant care: A new program is in the works where Basis Health will provide a monitor watch to keep track of vitals 24 hours a day. When asked, the CEO said they're relocating because they 'love the area'.

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picksa
pick.content:
• STEM work: The EMPOWER Accelerator is seeking applications for the first cohort.
  • Wheels: The Amazeum is hosting a bike drive for charity.
  • Salute: Veterans were recently honored at a high school event in Farmington.
  • Good grades: Schools in Springdale are receiving money for high scores on the ACT.
  • Lit: The Stewart Family lights are back.
  • Slots: Get your business or event can be in the newsletter by sending us a note here.
